p: The museum also has challenges to overcome, from interpreting the researchers’ often highly theoretical perspectives to balancing the researchers’ needs with those of museum guests. Insight and careful balance are essential for increasing scientists’ awareness of field-specific jargon and developing appropriate educational activities. The museum provides a real-life context in which to present scientific information to the public through different activities; practical methodologies need to be developed that allow the museum to mediate between the researchers and the museum guests to ensure effective science communication ( 9).
